description: These vegan gluten-free Spanish beans are packed with flavour, but are so easy to make in less than 20 minutes with just 7 ingredients! Perfect served with rice or fresh bread and only 125 calories per serving.
keywords: spanish beans, spanish recipe, tapas, vegan gluten free
name: Spanish Beans with Tomatoes
recipeIngredient: 1 teaspoon sweet smoked paprika (pimenton dulce - or hot paprika if you like it spicy)
2 cans butter beans (400ml/14oz (lima beans), drained and rinsed)

recipeInstructions.text: In a large saucepan, heat the oil over a medium heat. Add the onions and fry, stirring continuously, for 3-5 minutes until translucent but not browned.
Add the garlic, paprika and bay leaves and fry for a further minute.

Add the beans and tomatoes. Stir and break up the tomatoes a bit, then season with salt and pepper. Stir well and reduce the heat to low. Simmer for 15 minutes, checking regularly so it doesn’t stick to the bottom of the pan.
As it finishes, stir the spinach through to wilt.
Serve hot or cold, as tapas or a side dish, sprinkled with the fresh parsley.

video.description: These Spanish Beans with tomatoes and smokey sweet spices are easy to make in less than 20 minutes. They’re perfect as tapas, a main meal or a side dish. Vegan and gluten-free. They're a very popular recipe on my site with hundreds of readers loving them.
video.name: Spanish Beans
